title: [Large-Scale] Workshop on Developing Computational Thinking Metrics in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics instruction experience and basic computational thinking concepts
context.additional_context: A process for in-service elementary teachers to explore the development and application of computational thinking assessment metrics in VR-simulated math classes

learning_goals: Learners can identify computational thinking indicators (problem decomposition, abstraction, pattern recognition, algorithm design, generalization) with over 80% accuracy during mathematical problem-solving
Learners can design scoring rubrics to assess students' computational thinking levels in VR-based simulation environments

Learners can apply 4 computational thinking indicators (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithms) to a math class case (calculus concept explanation) and draft a 3–5-page lesson design plan. They can receive ≥4/5 scores in ≥2 out of 3 peer evaluation rubric criteria (clarity, creativity, practicality) and improve based on feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
